reviews.review_msg: Great guy and I would take his class again.  Very reading heavy but is a very fair marker and accessible outside of class hours.
Wayne was awesome. Best feedback I have received and makes a material that can be long feel short. Enjoyed both papers and almost every class.
Lots of reading, but Wayne is the nicest prof I have had at SFU. He legit cares about what he's teaching and you can tell.

I took this class as an elective. The class was dry every single time. He just summarized books, what a certain theme meant. No class participation required in the lecture as he talks the whole way through with no break. He expects a lot from you for mediocre lectures and a disorganized syllabus and all papers had vague guidelines.

Wayne is super chill. Books that he chose for the course were really interesting. He's really clear about what he wants for the essays, and if you show up to class, you'll know exactly what he's looking for. The whole class is participation (20%) + 3 essays (80%), and the essays are short (6-8 pages). Cool guy, very informal teaching style.

Doesn't seem like he cares about his students that much. Lectures aren't really mandatory. He just gives summaries of books you need to read, which may be good if you didn't read them (although you could just do the same online). Doesn't give the friendliest vibe but still an alright professor despite a bit of vulgarity here and there.

Lots of reading, be prepared. Some books are completely boring, others a bit better. He gives good feedback though, I find the TA's may mark easier than him. So if you can get a tutorial with a TA over him, it may be a bit easier on your mark. Overall class was moderate.

Not sure why Wayne is getting such negative reviews. I took him in 2016 spring (late comment) and we had 3 papers and a final. Lectures were dry but that's because I wasn't interested in the content. Wayne was witty and gave a lot of feedback! I put little to no effort into the course and still received a B+. Would definitely take again.

While I like Prof Knight's attitude I cannot say I enjoyed any part of his teaching style or class material. Lectures were beyond boring, and as a second year student, who has taken humanities classes before, I found a lot of his lectures irrelevant. Midterm  20 multiple choice. Final paper prompt was absurdly stupid. The TA was of no help.

Wayne is one of the most confusing prof I've ever taken. He is all over the place with his lecture. He can be talking one book and leads of to topics that just confuse the students even more. His voice is boring, makes the lecture really unbearable. He is very unclear with what he wants for the papers. No outline for a first year Writing course..

Really good professor. He is a tough marker, and will give  a lot of feedback  (maybe more than you asked for...). If you're looking for an easy A I wouldn't recommend, but if you really want to learn and have discussions, he's great.

Wayne is a good prof and he knows what he's talking about. The course is easy if you are willing to read the books and write a great paper. His feedback was really helpful, and his marking for the papers were very fair. Lectures were super boring though, tutorials are mandatory!

I didn't think I would enjoy his class, as I took it literally as an intro to Humanties but I loved it. He's a great professor, knowledgable of the topics, and helpful plus understanding. I had him as a tutorial leader as well, and he was just as great a tutorial leader as he was in lecture.

He understands the topic of what he is teaching but if you have a specific question he skirts around it and you end up more confused then before. Lectures feel very long, everything he says you can look up online. If you're a decent writer this class isn't hard. He even expressed that this semester had the highest class drop he's ever had.

He is a super nice guy! Very funny and the lectures are usually interesting enough... The material however is a bit of a pain... The books are long and boring and the essays are even worse! Most of the time I left class or tutorial in a good mood but extremely confused... If you aren't interested in philosophers this class is not for you

Wayne was a great prof! Although he is a little bit "out there," he seemed to be very into what he was teaching and it made it very interesting. Everything was marked fairly easily (by all of the profs it seemed). Honestly I only read about half of every book and still got an A. Dedicated prof, LOTS of reading, easy marking, easy course.

He is a tough grader. Don't take hum 101 if you are looking for a gpa booster unless you enjoy reading books by Plato, Diderot or Saint Augustine. Which I personally found very boring. His lectures were confusing and his tutorials were even more confusing. Overall, he is a good person, not a professor.

Dr. Knights is a great professor. Amazing knowledge in his field, laid back personality, makes essay writing very accessible to the new university student, makes some great jokes, fair grader, very easy to talk to. The only fault with the course is that the material is sometimes quite ambiguous, making papers difficult to write.

Hes a really great prof. This was my favourite class. He was kind and patient when he answered my questions. Hes open-minded and does not judge you based on your perspectives. Although quietly spoken, his lectures are inspirational and eye-opening. I had a really great time enjoying his lectures, and I hope to see him again in future!

- I would highly recommend this class to anyone who likes to think about the big issues in society and life. The class was great largely because Wayne had his stuff well thought out and delivered some interesting insights while still allowing some discussion even in lecture. Doesn't hurt he is one of the funniest prof/ teacher I've had to date.

-lectures are useless; just reads off his notes which are posted on canvas. does not offer much insight as to how he grades your paper. really seems very uninterested in what hes talking about. think sfu needs to get new humanities professors. this guys disinterest is honestly contagious. super boring class, wouldve been fun with someone else.

Wayne is pretty funny, but I don't really like the teaching style of the class. It was just him talking for 2 hours straight with no powerpoint slides and us taking notes. My TA was useless and tutorials usually just consisted of her rambling and going off topic. Overall, I think he could have picked more interesting books and better TA's.
Easiest and  most helpful teacher: you cannot get below a B if you show up (sometimes) and give him a reasonable paper. No research required!
Hilarious and always available for help.
He is so easy-going. I did almost nothing in the course and still got a B. The marking is fair.
really nice man. easy work. impossible to get less than a B. Just use sparknotes.
Great person to learn from.  Very clear in lectures, always open for discussion and willing to help.  Highly recommended!!!  Best class I've taken so far.

He is the best. Very nice and humorous, also extremely knowledgeable. His lectures were very insightful and intriguing. He will introduce you to some amazing literature that will affect your life. Do go to his lecture, you will learn a ton. Definitely take your HUM course with him. It's a shame if you are in SFU and never take his class.
The best prof I have ever had in SFU, make sure you don't miss this one.
Great prof, fun class. Lots..lots of reading

Very laid back, pretty funny, nice guy. Accommodating as well, will help you with papers and he'll give you options if you want to contest a grade. A fairly easy marker imo. The texts are important texts from across all cultures and periods.
Overall, he was a great prof. Really enjoyed his class. He makes his lectures very clear and the tutorials were useful too.
Tons of reading but worth it. Subject matter very interesting. Wayne could be more energetic while teaching but his laid back style also makes the subject matter less daunting.
Great guy, fun classes and it's impossible to get less than a B. Need I say more?

Just an all around great prof. Well versed in the subject, but also relaxed and well spoken. What university should be: a place to bounce around ideas, read the great texts of history and then analyze and respond to them. Awesome guy.

Funny, relaxed and interesting but not super academic (can be a good/bad thing). Cancelled the final exam for this class two semesters in a row now and made the grade based on discussion and seven two-paged papers. Usually gets the papers back fairly quickly and with helpful feedback. All in all a great prof!

this guy's the greatest! had my serious doubts at first, especially concerning the course material, but they quickly faded away.  too lazy to explain why he's a great prof, just take one of his courses and witness first hand
